content.raw:
I didn't think about LabVIEW.

If I understand [http://docs.h5py.org/en/latest/strings.html#how-to-store-text-strings](http://docs.h5py.org/en/latest/strings.html#how-to-store-text-strings) correctly h5py stores everything as ascii or utf8 internally anyway. Looking at the connection table the dtypes are all still byte strings so that should not change in the hdf5 file.

But testing will reveal if I'm right or not.
content.html:
I didn't think about LabVIEW.

If I understand http://docs.h5py.org/en/latest/strings.html#how-to-store-text-strings correctly h5py stores everything as ascii or utf8 internally anyway. Looking at the connection table the dtypes are all still byte strings so that should not change in the hdf5 file.

But testing will reveal if I'm right or not.
